news_header: Mysterious grey and white balls have led to the closure of several Sydney beaches as authorities investigate their origin.
news_text: Months after black balls caused the closure of Sydney's beaches, new grey and white debris has appeared, prompting the closure of nine beaches, including Manly and Dee Why. Authorities are investigating the source, which remains unknown, raising safety concerns. The previous black balls were linked to a sewage spill, but the current debris's composition is still being tested. The Northern Beaches Council and the EPA are involved in the investigation, urging the public to report sightings.
